intro: Hedyotis devicolamensis, commonly known as the Himalayan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes, often in temperate climates. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture.
